li.p: Let’s get growing.

Save money the Idaho way.
It pays to choose Idaho.
Prosper in our business-friendly climate.
Our partnerships fuel growth.
Behind every great company is a great workforce.
Realize your potential in an Opportunity Zone.
Lower taxes bolster business.
Discover the Gem State.
Moving at the speed of business.
Market comparisons made easy.
A balanced mix of traditional and emerging industries.
The time is now.

Our team is here to help.

div.h1: We’re here to help Idaho businesses affected by COVID-19.
div.p: The novel Coronavirus began shortly after the start of the new year and has caused disruptions in ordinary business functions and economic injury throughout the state. The event led to a State Disaster Declaration signed by Governor Brad Little on March 13th, 2020.

On March 25, 2020, Governor Little issued a 21-day stay-home order and signed an extreme emergency declaration. On April 15,2020, Governor Little extended the stay-home order through April 30, 2020. Idahoans may leave their residences only for essential services, activities, governmental functions, or to operate essential businesses. For answers to frequently asked questions, please review the FAQ information as well as guidance from the Attorney General’s Office. For the latest COVID-19 information and official State updates, visit coronavirus.idaho.gov.
div.h2: Idaho Rebounds: Our Path to Prosperity
div.p: Governor Brad Little, with the help of the Idaho Department of Health and Welfare and guidance issued by President Donald Trump and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, launched “Idaho Rebounds: Our Path to Prosperity,” a data-driven approach to opening up Idaho’s economy. The approach reduces the risk of COVID-19 to Idaho’s most vulnerable population and preserves capacity in our healthcare system, while opening up businesses safely. From an economic standpoint, Idaho’s rebound from COVID-19 starts with employee and consumer confidence, which leads into business stability and growth and eventually promotion and attraction.

li.p: Each stage, while allowing for additional businesses and practices to open and loosen, is grounded in public health and safety best practices for individuals and businesses.
The goal of the Governor’s Economic Rebound Advisory Committee is to provide recommendations in support of the State’s economic recovery caused by COVID-19.

h3.a: SBA Emergency Assistance and CARES Act Relief

li.p: For resources from the SBA on their Economic Injury Disaster Loan program, Payment Protection Program (PPP), Express Bridge Loans and 7(a) Loan options.

h3.a: CARES Act Information from the US Treasury

li.p: For the latest information on the CARES Act from the US Treasury to help taxpayers, businesses and others affected by the Coronavirus.
A quick guide from the US Travel Association for all businesses to help better understand CARES Act relief options.

h3.a: USDA COVID-19 Federal Rural Resource Guide

li.p: USDA and its Federal partners have programs that can be used to provide immediate and long-term assistance to rural communities affected by the COVID-19 outbreak.

h3.a: SWIMA Sourcing Requests and Manufacturing Resources

li.p: For more information from the Southwest Idaho Manufacturers’ Alliance on their efforts to compile sourcing opportunities for critical supplies.
Assistance and resources from interet service providers and telecom companies across Idaho.
The Idaho Small Business Development Center is available to work with your business, answer questions, provide resources, and advocating for your business during through this period.

h3.a: Idaho Women’s Business Center COVID-19 Resources

li.p: The Idaho Women’s Business Center is providing resources and links to help as your business plans next steps.

h3.a: Idaho Department of Labor COVID-19 Resources

li.p: The Idaho Department of Labor is available to assist employers and workers through the impact of the coronavirus.
Details on the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA).
Resources and information for the Idaho travel and tourism industry.

p.em: Information contained on this page and linked pages is subject to change. All information, documents, and resource links provided by the Idaho Department of Commerce are for information purposes only. Please consult with your legal and financial advisors for recommendations specific to your business or organization.
